paper_metadata.title: Grain for Green Program in China: Migration impacts from cropland conversion to forest

program_information.program_name: Grain for Green (GfG) Program / Sloping Land Conversion Program / Conversion of Cropland to Forest Program
program_information.target_population: Farmers with cropland on steep slopes or ecologically sensitive areas

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: the central government compensates farmers to convert cropland on steep slopes or otherwise ecologically sensitive areas to forest or grassland | paying them an amount equivalent to the lost crop revenue

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: we use a difference-in-difference estimation approach to examine the role of migration as a household-level response to the GfG Program | our subsequent regression results suggest that after about 10 years, the overall incomes of GfG and non-GfG households did not significantly differ from each other
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: we use a difference-in-difference estimation approach

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: Under the GfG Program-also known as the Sloping Land Conversion or Conversion of Cropland to Forest Program
evidence_citations.country_citation: In the late 1990s, China's Yangtze and Yellow River Basins suffered devastating natural disasters
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: the central government compensates farmers to convert cropland on steep slopes or otherwise ecologically sensitive areas to forest or grassland
